definition: abbr. for Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区[Ning2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]/abbr. for Nanjing 南京[Nan2 jing1]/surname Ning

sentences.english: No thanks. I‘d rather run Iraq.
sentences.chinese: 不，谢了，我宁愿去掌管伊拉克。

sentences.english: I would rather have noodles than rice.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿吃面条也不吃米饭。

sentences.english: I would rather be scolded than cheat (others).
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿挨骂不愿欺骗人。

sentences.english: All this gracious living isn't for me, I prefer the simple life.
sentences.chinese: 这优裕的生活不适合我，我宁愿过简朴的生活。

sentences.english: She would rather tell the truth than lie.
sentences.chinese: 她宁愿讲实话而不愿说谎。

sentences.english: As a youth, I choose to live a busy and meaningful life.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个青年，我宁愿过忙碌而有意义的生活。

sentences.english: I'd rather not eat any melamine at all.
sentences.chinese: 我本人宁愿不吃任何含三聚氰胺的东西。

sentences.english: SAYID: No, you'd rather be out here alone and get lost or hurt.
sentences.chinese: 不，除非你宁愿一个人呆在这儿，迷路和受到伤害。

sentences.english: I think I'd rather go to the rink.
Rather than by the scourge, I also want to do an indomitable spirit of man.
sentences.chinese: 宁愿遭天谴，我也要做一个顶天立地的男人。

sentences.english: I’d rather live with a good question than a bad answer.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿提一个好问题也不愿意给出一个坏答案。

sentences.english: The law prefers to let off for one's past wrongdoings.
sentences.chinese: 法律有时宁愿放过一个人过去的罪行。

sentences.english: Id rather he hadnt told me about it.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿他没告诉我这事。

sentences.english: If memories of drinks, would rather get drunk.
sentences.chinese: 回忆若能下酒，宁愿一醉方休。

sentences.english: Retirement-age teachers opt to teach longer.
sentences.chinese: 快退休的老师宁愿多教几年书。

definition: preferably/one would prefer to...(or not to...)/would rather/(would) be better to/(to pick) the lesser of two evils
would rather.../it would be better.../would prefer
willingness/would rather (agree to X than Y)
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps
to be willing to part with sth
to hate to do sth/to hate to part with/to begrudge
